title: Boosting Convolutional Neural Networks' Protein Binding Site Prediction Capacity Using SE(3)-invariant transformers, Transfer Learning and Homology-based Augmentation. (arXiv:2303.08818v1 [q-bio.QM])
abstract: Figuring out small molecule binding sites in target proteins, in the resolution of either pocket or residue, is critical in many virtual and real drug-discovery scenarios. Since it is not always easy to find such binding sites based on domain knowledge or traditional methods, different deep learning methods that predict binding sites out of protein structures have been developed in recent years. Here we present a new such deep learning algorithm, that significantly outperformed all state-of-the-art baselines in terms of the both resolutions$\unicode{x2013}$pocket and residue. This good performance was also demonstrated in a case study involving the protein human serum albumin and its binding sites. Our algorithm included new ideas both in the model architecture and in the training method. translated_abstract: 在许多虚拟和真实的药物研发方案中，确定目标蛋白中小分子结合位点，无论是在口袋还是残基级别上的解析，都是至关重要的。由于基于领域知识或传统方法查找这些结合位点并不总是容易的，因此近年来已开发出了不同的深度学习方法来预测蛋白质结构中的结合位点。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的深度学习算法，它在口袋和残基的两个分辨率上显著优于所有最先进的基线。该算法的性能也表现出在一个关于人血清白蛋白及其结合位点的案例研究中。我们的算法包括模型架构和训练方法中的新想法。对于模型架构，它包含SE(3)不变形自我注意力层，这些层在残基级别的CNN输出之上运行。模型的残基级别处理允许一个有效的、可传输的迁移学习和基于同源的数据扩增。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新的深度学习算法来预测蛋白质结构中的结合位点，在口袋和残基的两个分辨率上性能显著优于所有最先进的基线，并具有有效的、可传输的迁移学习和基于同源的数据扩增。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new deep learning algorithm for predicting protein binding sites in the structure, which outperforms state-of-the-art baselines in terms of both pocket and residue resolutions, and includes effective and transferable transfer learning and homology-based data augmentation.
